sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Find the chromatic index of the graph below:

```
   1--2--3--4
   |  |  |  |
   5--6--7--8
```
Note: The chromatic index of a graph is the smallest number of colors needed to color the edges of the graph so that no two adjacent edges receive the same color.
message_2:
To find the chromatic index of the given graph, we can use the edge coloring technique. We will start by assigning colors to the edges in a way that no two adjacent edges have the same color.

```
   1--2--3--4
   |  |  |  |
   5--6--7--8
```

We can color the edges as follows:

```
   1--(1)--2--(2)--3--(1)--4
   |        |        |        |
  (2)      (3)      (2)      (3)
   |        |        |        |
   5--(1)--6--(2)--7--(1)--8
```

In this coloring, we used 3 colors (1, 2, and 3) to color the edges of the graph so that no two adjacent edges have the same color. Therefore, the chromatic index of the given graph is 3.
